page.title: 07POLICING,WEST WIVELISCOMBE
page.content:
We interviewed our local policeman, Mr Searle, who lives in the police house next to the school.
He told us that the hardest crimes he usually has to deal with are vandalism and theft. The sort of trouble that young people tend to get into stems from boredom _ petty vandalism etc. In the country, quite a lot of farming machinery is stolen.
The policeman also said that the most money ever stolen was Â£500, from an old lady. The oldest person he had ever arrested was 70 years old (for drinking and driving), and the youngest person was 16 years old (for theft). Mr Searle also said that the biggest burglary lately was in our local jewellery shop.
